intro: Scorzonera ahmet-duranii, commonly known as the Turkish scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellowish to orange-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat. Scorzonera ahmet-duranii is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
